definition: to offer excuses (colloquial)/to stall
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.english: The auspicious wish to work in the troupe, xiu-fang been feuding with reason.
sentences.chinese: 其祥希望在劇團工作，秀芳用藉口推搪。

sentences.english: Catalpa Po for repair units as soon as possible the owner, the owner of lining.
sentences.chinese: 梓博要求業主儘快維修單位，業主諸多推搪。

sentences.english: They said it was our culture and tradition.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是用文化和傳統等理由來推搪。

sentences.english: When David was confronted about his sin, he made no excuses.
sentences.chinese: 當大衛被當面痛斥其罪時，他並沒有藉詞推搪。

definition: to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to evade/to shirk
to make an excuse/pretext/excuse
to repel/to decline
to use all sorts of excuses
to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
to plead/to claim as an excuse

to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly

to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
